meanings.definition: A tool or utensil used for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: I used the implement to fix the broken chair.
meanings.sent2: The chef's favorite implement in the kitchen is a sharp knife.
meanings.sent3: The spoon, a common implement, decided to take a break from stirring.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was an implement that sculpted beautiful stories.
meanings.sent5: The hammer, a sturdy implement, pounded the nail into the wood.

meanings.definition: To put a decision, plan, agreement, etc. into effect.
meanings.sent1: The team will implement the new strategy next week.
meanings.sent2: It is important to implement safety measures in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The idea to implement a nap time at work was met with cheers.
meanings.sent4: She implemented her study schedule like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The teacher implemented a fun game to teach math concepts effectively.

meanings.sent1: He will implement the plan to clean up the park.
meanings.sent2: The company promised to implement changes for better customer service.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to implement its plan for world domination.
meanings.sent4: She implemented her promise to visit the elderly neighbor every week.
meanings.sent5: The athlete implemented a strict training regimen to improve performance.
